author: Kukusho
body: Even the "0" from c0in base is a ZERO, the I is probably a L. And I am not familiar with the exchange, but I am pretty sure they type it as one single word.  Okay, now being more serious, this attempt is obviously a scam, but sometimes they are hard to detect, the scammers will contact you using the official coinbase or binance SMS and if you scroll up you will see legit previous SMS.  Whenever you receive a suspicious SMS never tap on the link or call the phone they tell you to.  Just go to the official website from your browser, type it yourself, don't use a link, and change your password.  Best of luck!

author: AmbitiousNectarine79
body: Yes that's a scam, if anyone gets in contact with you, it will be a proper support email from the proper channels of coinbase support. The moment you receive anything do some research, and go to the support team on coinbase and directly message them from your email, the coinbase website or app to confirm they sent something to you. And if you feel personally that you might be on the wrong end of the stick and something is fishy, go into your security settings and lock your account immediately  Keep Vigilant out there!
